name: compact fluorescent lamp production | compact fluorescent lamp | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20571/documentation

This activity represents the production and disposal of an average compact fluorescent lamp which is circa 75 g in mass (excluding packaging). It has the envisaged lifetime of 1.1 years (10000 hours of operational time), 10W power and is manufactured in Europe. The figures on material inputs from technosphere and energy required to produce an average compact fluorescent lamp are taken from Elijosiute et al. 2012. The figure on the annual production volume (2.9 million units) is from Worldwatch Institute 2009. 

This activity starts with the reception of materials at the factory.

The activity includes the processes of material and energy use in manufacturing an average compact fluorescent lamp. The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials. Packaging is not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/274:Manufacture of electric lighting equipment/2740:Manufacture of electric lighting equipment

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The literature sources used refer to the underpinning technology as being current.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Geography GLO was chosen because the dataset aims to represent the production of an average compact fluoresecent lamp. The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in Europe.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Manufacturing data are taken from Elijosiute et al. 2012. Data on the annual production volume are taken from Worldwatch Institute 2009. Sources: Elijosiute, K., Balciukeviciute, J., and Danafas, G., 2012. Life Cycle Assessment of Compact Fluorescent and Incadescent Lamps: Comparative Analysis. Environmental Research, Engineering and Management, 3(61), 65-72. Worldwatch Institute 2009. Strong Growth in Compact Fluorescent Bulbs Reduces Electricity Demand. Worldwatch Institute, Washington, DC, USA. Available from: http://www.worldwatch.org/node/5920 (Accessed 20 January 2018).
